meanings.definition: The process of making something denser or more compact.
meanings.sent1: The densification of the soil helped improve its stability.
meanings.sent2: The densification of the snow made it perfect for building a snowman.
meanings.sent3: The densification of the cake batter made it easier to pour into the pan.
meanings.sent4: The densification of the traffic on the highway turned it into a parking lot.
meanings.sent5: The densification of the clouds signaled an impending storm.

meanings.definition: The act of increasing the population density of an area.
meanings.sent1: The densification of the city led to more crowded streets.
meanings.sent2: The densification of the neighborhood brought more people together.
meanings.sent3: The densification of the park made it feel like a bustling city center.
meanings.sent4: The densification of the school bus caused laughter and chatter to fill the air.
meanings.sent5: The densification of the party made it a lively gathering.

meanings.definition: The state of being denser or more compact.
meanings.sent1: The densification of the material increased its strength.
meanings.sent2: The densification of the fabric made it more durable.
meanings.sent3: The densification of the bookshelf made it difficult to add more books.
meanings.sent4: The densification of the forest created a sense of mystery and darkness.
meanings.sent5: The densification of the stars in the sky made the night seem magical.
